summary: U.S. Customs and Border Protection employs more than 45,000 law enforcement personnel. In recent years, CBP has fallen short of staffing targets, while encounters with noncitizens at the border have greatly increased. Since our 2018 report on this topic, CBP bolstered its recruitment, hiring, and retention efforts. title: U.S. Customs and Border Protection: Efforts to Improve Recruitment, Hiring, and Retention of Law Enforcement Personnel
